alert.note: Alert for Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 9:37PM PST until January 04 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Weather Continues through Early Tuesday... .A weather system continues to bring snow to the mountains of interior NorCal through early Tuesday. Strong winds will also accompany this weather system and could cause limited visibility at times as well as downed tree branches and weakened trees. The strongest winds will be over Plumas County and eastern Shasta County above 4,000 feet where gusts up to 65+ mph will be possible, causing downed trees and power lines. If you`re planning travel over the mountains, check the latest forecasts and road conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 5500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Expect damage to trees and power lines as well. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches will localized amounts up to 8 inches are expected. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park. * WHEN...Until 7 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
